currentDoc: Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why woulod

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this?

You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

"You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain.

"You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

"You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic,

You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away f

"You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity.

You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity.

"You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do.

The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity.

"You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity.

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity.

You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee t

You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that

"You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit."

You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity.

"You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity.

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity.

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity.

The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For o

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you rel

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your h

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and faim

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

You are beginning to get frustrated wit

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

You are beginning to get frustrated with this whole situ

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

You are beginning to get frustrated with this whole situation. Who is this tiny creature to tell you wat

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

You are beginning to get frustrated with this whole situation. Who is this tiny creature to tell you what to do and who you have to be?

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

You are beginning to get frustrated with this whole situation. Who is this tiny creature to tell you what to do and who you have to be? A devious plan begins to form in your mind. What if

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity.

Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

You are beginning to get frustrated with this whole situation. Who is this tiny creature to tell you what to do and who you have to be? A devious plan begins to form in your mind. What if this creature we

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

You are beginning to get frustrated with this whole situation. Who is this tiny creature to tell you what to do and who you have to be? A devious plan begins to form in your mind. What if this creature were to die? Then it would be like none of this situation ever

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

You are beginning to get frustrated with this whole situation. Who is this tiny creature to tell you what to do and who you have to be? A devious plan begins to form in your mind. What if this creature were to die? Then it would be like none of this situation ever occurred. You could go on living your life as a human, and no one would be the wiser. You only hesitate

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" You look down and see a tiny bee in a suit and tie. You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

You look at the bee and say "I'm allergic to bees." The bee looks at you and says "I'm sorry, Your Majesty, but I'm afraid I must carry out my orders." "You have been lied to all your life, and you aren't really allergic to bees." You are in utter shock. Why would the people you trust lie to you about something like this? You look at the bee and say "What do you mean I'm not allergic to bees?" The bee looks at you and says "You are the queen of bees, Your Majesty."

This seems so impossible. The queen of bees? But you are a person, right. You look at the tiny figure and ask him to explain. The bee says that you were found when you were very little by a family that took you in. You had been born a bee, and were a bee when you were found. Over time, however, as the human family nursed you to health, you became more and more human. By the time you had reached 2 years of age, you were completely in human form. You had no memory of your life as a bee, and the family had no memory of ever having found you. All they seemed to know was that they were afraid of bees. Your human family convinced themselves that you were allergic, as a trick to keep you away from bees and finding out your real identity. 

 This all seems too fantastic to believe. You ask the bee what you should do. The bee says that you should return to the hive, and that you will be welcomed with open arms. "How can I return to the hive? I am huge and a human, and I certainly wouldn't fit." The bee tells you that as you get closer to your hive of origin you will return to your original form and become an insect once again. You aren't really sure you like this idea. For one, you have convinced yourself that bees will bring you harm. For another, you really like your human life and family. You ask the bee if you can stay the way you are. The bee says that the queen of bees can never be anything but a bee.

You are beginning to get frustrated with this whole situation. Who is this tiny creature to tell you what to do and who you have to be? A devious plan begins to form in your mind. What if this creature were to die? Then it would be like none of this situation ever occurred. You could go on living your life as a human, and no one would be the wiser. You only hesitate for a second lon
